snippet: Mr. Cruz turned the solicitor’s office into a defender of the right wing and he made crucial friends in Texas — though he once angered Bush family allies.
abstract: Republican presidential candidate Ted Cruz used his position as Texas solicitor general as springboard for his political career; conservative legal record he amassed and connections he made during hist tenure helped carry him into United States Senate in 2012 and are now helping to propel his presidential candidacy.

byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez contributed reporting, and Kitty Bennett contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Mr. Cruz turned the solicitor’s office into a defender of the right wing and he made crucial friends in Texas — though he once angered Bush family allies.

headline.main: Ted Cruz Promoted Himself and Conservative Causes as Texas’ Solicitor General
headline.print_headline: Cruz Adopted Activist Vision as State Lawyer
